title: Drawing, "Ceiling Design for Numa Pompilius Welcomed to Rome after his Election, Sala di Numa Pompilio, Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza", 1804–05
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk on white laid paper
markings: Marks: lower part of Strasburg bend
inscribed: in pen and brown ink, upper center: 2; lower center: e il senato/ il popolo romano viene a incontre/ numa
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Numa accompanied by two mace bearers, shown in profile near altar, with crowds at left and upon Capitoline stairs.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Ceiling Design for Numa Pompilius Welcomed to Rome after his Election, Sala di Numa Pompilio, Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza", 1804–05.
1804–05. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk on white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3450.
